Working with HTTP headers

Working with HTTP headers

Examples

(x <- HttpClient$new(url = "https://httpbin.org"))
#> <crul connection> 
#>   url: https://httpbin.org
#>   curl options: 
#>   proxies: 
#>   headers: 

# set headers
(res <- HttpClient$new(
  url = "https://httpbin.org",
  opts = list(
    verbose = TRUE
  ),
  headers = list(
    a = "stuff",
    b = "things"
  )
))
#> <crul connection> 
#>   url: https://httpbin.org
#>   curl options: 
#>     verbose: TRUE
#>   proxies: 
#>   headers: 
#>     a: stuff
#>     b: things
res$headers
#> $a
#> [1] "stuff"
#> 
#> $b
#> [1] "things"
#> 
# reassign header value
res$headers$a <- "that"
# define new header
res$headers$c <- "what"
# request
res$get('get')
#> <crul response> 
#>   url: https://httpbin.org/get
#>   request_headers: 
#>     useragent: libcurl/7.51.0 r-curl/2.3 crul/0.3.0.9100
#>     a: that
#>     b: things
#>     c: what
#>   response_headers: 
#>     status: HTTP/1.1 200 OK
#>     server: nginx
#>     date: Wed, 22 Feb 2017 18:41:21 GMT
#>     content-type: application/json
#>     content-length: 315
#>     connection: keep-alive
#>     access-control-allow-origin: *
#>     access-control-allow-credentials: true
#>   status: 200

## setting content-type via headers
(res <- HttpClient$new(
  url = "https://httpbin.org",
  opts = list(
    verbose = TRUE
  ),
  headers = list(`Content-Type` = "application/json")
))
#> <crul connection> 
#>   url: https://httpbin.org
#>   curl options: 
#>     verbose: TRUE
#>   proxies: 
#>   headers: 
#>     Content-Type: application/json
res$get('get')
#> <crul response> 
#>   url: https://httpbin.org/get
#>   request_headers: 
#>     useragent: libcurl/7.51.0 r-curl/2.3 crul/0.3.0.9100
#>     Content-Type: application/json
#>   response_headers: 
#>     status: HTTP/1.1 200 OK
#>     server: nginx
#>     date: Wed, 22 Feb 2017 18:41:21 GMT
#>     content-type: application/json
#>     content-length: 300
#>     connection: keep-alive
#>     access-control-allow-origin: *
#>     access-control-allow-credentials: true
#>   status: 200
